H0.text: Roots are the part of a sunflower plant that absorb water and nutrients.

H1.text: Stems absorb water and nutrients in a sunflower plant.

H2.text: Leaves are the part of a sunflower plant that absorb water and nutrients.

H3.text: Flowers are the part of a sunflower plant that absorbs water and nutrients.

A5.text: Root epidermal cells and root hairs take up soil water and dissolved ions; these are then conducted to the shoot via the xylem.
